intro: Fimbristylis nanofusca, commonly known as the dwarf spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and tiny, clustered spikelets that give it a distinctive appearance. Native to wetlands and swampy areas in tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in moist, acidic soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its humid environment. Fimbristylis nanofusca plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
